internal.database

Class BpTree<K extends Comparable<K>,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • internal.database.BpTree<K,V>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Map<K,V>, SortedMap<K,V>

    public class BpTree<K extends Comparable<K>,V>
extends AbstractMap<K,V>
implements Serializable, Cloneable, SortedMap<K,V>
    This class provides B+Tree maps. B+Trees are used as multi-level index structures that provide efficient access for both point queries and range queries.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  BpTree.Node
      This inner class defines nodes that are stored in the B+tree map.
      private class  BpTree.Pair
      This inner class is used to hold all pairs of Keys and their References for the sorting purpose.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.util.AbstractMap

        AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<K,V>, AbstractMap.SimpleImmutableEntry<K,V>

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface java.util.Map

        Map.Entry<K,V>

      • insert

        private void insert(K key,
          V ref,
          BpTree.Node n,
          BpTree.Node p)
        Recursive helper function for inserting a key in B+trees.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to insert
        ref - the value/node to insert
        n - the current node
        p - the parent node

      • insertIntoParent

        private void insertIntoParent(K key,
                    BpTree.Node leftRef,
                    BpTree.Node rightRef,
                    BpTree.Node parent)
        This method has a recursive manner from the bottom of the B+ Tree upto a node which does not need spliting. This is used when a leaf is splited and we need to insert a new value into its parent.
        Parameters:
        key - The new value to be inserted into the parent
        leftRef - Left reference for that new key
        rightRef - right reference for that new key
        parent - the node which we want to add the new key

      • wedge

        private void wedge(K key,
         V ref,
         BpTree.Node n,
         int i)
        Wedge the key-ref pair into node n.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to insert
        ref - the value/node to insert
        n - the current node
        i - the insertion position within node n

        private BpTree.Node split(K key,
                V ref,
                BpTree.Node n)
        Split node n and return the newly created node.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to insert
        ref - the value/node to insert
        n - the current node

        public static void main(String[] args)

        the - command-line arguments (args [0] gives number of keys to insert)
